page.title: 01THE BROWNHILLS AREA.
page.content: The Brownhills area falls into two distinct regions. The western side, in the Walsall Metropolitan Borough, is largely industrial and residential, whilst the eastern area, in Staffordshire, is predominantly rural. Principal settlements in the west are{Brownhills}and{Walsall Wood}which form a continuous urban development. {Clayhanger}is a small, isolated village within this region.On the eastern side the major settlement is the village of{Stonnall}but there is also some ribbon development as well as separate farmsteads. The focus of the road system is the Shire Oak crossroads where the A452(T) (Chester Road) crosses the A461 (Lichfield Road). Lichfield is approximately 9km from this point in a N.E direction whilst Walsall is 6km to the S.W.
